Manx: Roish Nee Ad Geamagh Neem’s Clashtyn
English: Before They Call I Will Hear (I)

Manx: Ren sharvaant aeg goll un laa gys e benainshter lesh seaghyn trome ayns e haigney. Cha row ee er clashtyn voish e moir v’ee cha graihagh urree son tra liauyr, as v’ee smooinniaghtyn dy row red ennagh er haghyrt jee ny veagh yn voir eck er screeu roish yn tra shen.
English: A young servant went one day to her mistress with heavy sorrow in her mind. She hadn’t heard from her mother, who she was so fond of, for a long time, and she was thinking that something had happened to her or her mother had (would have) written before that time.
Diplomatic: Ren shervaant aeg gholl un laa gys y ben anshter lesh seaghyn throme ayns y aigney Cha row er clashtyn voish y Moir vee cha graihagh urree son tra louyr, as vee smooinniaghtyn dy row red ennagh er haghyrt jee ny va’n voir eck er scrieu rosh yn tra shen

Manx: Ren yn ven anshter gra ree, dy cheau ny kiarailyn er y Çhiarn Yeesey as gyn dy ve ceaut sheese myr v’ee, ren yn çharvaant geaishtagh ree dy arryltagh as streeu dy yannoo myr ren e benainshter gra ree as loayrt rish yn Chiarn mychione yn oyr shoh.
English: The mistress said to her to cast the cares on the Lord Jesus and not to be downcast as she was. The servant listened to her willingly and strived to do as the mistress told her and spoke to the Lord about this reason.
Diplomatic: ~Ren yn ven anshter gra ree, dy cheau ny caaraillyn er y Chiarn Yeesey as gyn dy ve cheaut sheese myr vee, ren yn chervaant geashtagh ree dy arryltagh as strieu dy yannoo myr ren y ben anshter gra ree as loayrt rish yn Chiarn mychione yn oyr shoh

Manx: Cre cha leah as ren yn ansoor çheet . Moghrey laa ny vairagh, haink yn inneen gys y venainshter lesh eddin ghennal gra; “O ta mee er gheddyn scrieunyn as ta mee cha moarnagh jeh my scrieunyn.”
English: How soon the answer came. On the morning of the next day, the girl came to the mistress with a cheerful face saying “O I have received a letter and I’m so proud of my letter.
Diplomatic: cre cha leah as ren yn ansoor cheet . Moghrey laa ny vairagh, haink yn inneen gys y venainshter lesh eddyn gennal gra O ta mee er gheddyn scrieuyn as ta me cha moarnagh jeh my scrieuyn

Manx: Cre’n oyr dy row ee cha moyrnagh jeh ny screeunyn? Cre’n oyr dy row ee er gheddyn ad ayns ansoor gys padjer?
English: Why (was) she so proud of my letter? Why had she received them in answer to prayer?
Diplomatic: cre’n oyr dy ee cha moarnagh jeh my scrieuyn, cre’n oyr dy row ee er gheddyn ad ayns ansoor gys padjer,

Manx: Paart dy cheayrtyn ta Jee freayl shiu farkiagh son ansoor gys nyn badjeryn agh cheayrtyn elley gholl rish shoh t’Eh gansoor tappee as Eh clashtyn ec dy chooilley hraa. T’Eh ny cheayrtyn lhiggey shaghey agh t’Eh dy hrial nyn gredjue. Lhig dooin er-y-fa shen gyn dy bragh jannoo meecredjue nagh vel Eh clashtyn agh credjal dy shicker dy jean Eh, ayns E hraa hene cur ansoor dooin as cur dooin yeearree nyn ghreeghyn ayns e hraa hene as ayns yn aght Echey hene.
English: Sometimes God keeps you waiting waiting for an answer to your prayers, but at other times like this he answers fast and whilst he hears at all times. He sometimes delays, but he is to trying your faith. Let us therefore not ever lose belief that he hears but believe surely that he will, in his own time, give us an answer and give us the desire of our hearts in his own time and in his own way.
Diplomatic: paart dy cheayrtyn ta jee preeayl shiu farkiagh son ansoor gys nyn badjeryn agh cheayrtyn elley gholl rish shoh te gansoor thappee as eh clashtyn ec dy chooilley chra. te ny cheayrtyn liggey shaghey agh te dy chrial nyn credjue lhig doin eryfa shen gyn dy braagh jannoo meecredjue, nagh vel eh clashtyn agh credjal dy shiker dy jean eh ayns y chra hene cur ansoor doin as cur doin yeerree nyn ghreeghyn ayns y chra hene as ayns yn aght ec ehhene.

Manx: Screeuit ayns yn çhiaghtoo laa yeig jeh mee veanagh yn ouyr, ayns yn vlein hoght cheead yeig, kiare feed as ney jeig
English: Written in the seventeenth day of September, in the year eighteen hundred and ninety-nine.
Diplomatic: Scrieut ayns yn shiaghtoo laa yeig jeh mee veanagh yn ouyr, ayns yn vlein hoght cheead yeig, kair feed as nee jeig
